no_proxy.description: comma-seperated string that can contain IPs, CIDR notation, domain names that should be excluded from proxying. IP and domain names can contain port numbers

proxy_from_environment.description: Use proxy URL indicated by environment variables

proxy_connect_header.description: Specifies headers to send to proxies during CONNECT requests

ca_file.description: the file that contains a CA cert to verify requests with

cert_file.description: the file that contains the client cert to present when making requests

key_file.description: the file that contains the private key to use when making requests

server_name.description: the server name to present when doing client authentication

insecure_skip_verify.description: if true, don't validate the presented server certificate

min_version.description: the minimum version of TLS to support

max_version.description: the maximum version of TLS to support

http_config.description: settings to configure the behaviour of HTTP requests

max_alerts.description: The maximum number of alerts to include in a single webhook message. Alerts  above this threshold are truncated. When leaving this at its default value of 0, all alerts are included.

items.description: Configuration options for sending notifications to a webhook

send_resolved.description: whether to notify about resolved alerts

api_secret.description: The API key to use when talking to the WeChat API.

message.description: API request data as defined by the WeChat API.

message_type.description: Type of the message type, supported values are `text` and `markdown`.

agent_id.description: the ID of the agent to send messages as

to_user.description: the ID of the user to send messages to

to_party.description: the ID of the party so send messages to

items.description: Configuration options for sending notifications to WeChat
Configuration options for receivers to send notifications to

target_match_re.description: DEPRECATED: Use target_matchers.  Matchers that have to be fulfilled in the alerts to be muted, with values interpreted as a Regex

items.description: a matcher to match labels against

target_matchers.description: A list of matchers that have to be fulfilled by the target alerts to be muted.

source_match.description: DEPRECATED: Use source_matchers. Matchers for which one or more alerts have to exist for the inhibition to take effect.

schema.description: An Alertmanager compatible config file

get.summary: Get a flattened version of the routing tree

receiver.description: the receier to send alerts to

group_by.description: The labels by which incoming alerts are grouped together

continue.description: If true, any alerts that hit this node will continue matching other nodes along the tree

match.description: A set of equality matchers that an alert has to fulfull to match the node

match_re.description: A set of regex matchers that an alert has to fulfull to match the node

items.description: a matcher to match labels against

matchers.description: A list of matchers than an alert has to fulfill to match the node

mute_time_intervals.description: Times when the route should be muted. These must match the name of a mute time interval defined in the mute_time_intervals section

active_time_intervals.description: Times when the route should be active. These must match the name of a time interval defined in the time_intervals section.
